remarks: Two equivalent ways of expressing that ` R ` is a superposition of ` P ` and ` Q ` , which can replace the superposition part of ~ ishlat1 , ` ( x =/= y -> E. z e. A ( z =/= x /\ z =/= y /\ z .<_ ( x .\/ y ) ) ` ` ) ` , with the simpler ` E. z e. A ( x .\/ z ) = ( y .\/ z ) ` as shown in ~ ishlat3N .  (Contributed by NM, 5-Nov-2012.)
statement:
cvlsupr2.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
cvlsupr2.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
cvlsupr2.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
cvlsupr3 $p |- ( ( K e. CvLat /\ ( P e. A /\ Q e. A /\ R e. A ) ) -> ( ( P .\/ R ) = ( Q .\/ R ) <-> ( P =/= Q -> ( R =/= P /\ R =/= Q /\ R .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ) ) ) ) $.
